properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This advice message is issued for Beaufort, Langi Kal Kal, Lexton and Trawalla.
 
  • The Bayindeen-Rocky Road fire started last Thursday and has grown to the size 19,500 hectares.
  • Weather conditions are favourable for fire fighting efforts and burning out activities will occur in the next 24 hours.
  • This work is required ahead of Wednesday's predicted extreme fire danger rating.
  • Community may notice an increase in smoke in the area while the burning out activities are undertaken. 
  • Heavy plant, machinery and aircraft will be visible in the area. 

Planning for extreme fire danger Wednesday 28 February

  • Review your fire plan with household members today.
  • Consider leaving your property on Tuesday afternoon. 
  • If you have any questions about recovering from this fire, you should call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
The threat is reduced and it is now safe for you to return to your home or business.

Do no travel on closed roads.

You should stay informed as the fire situation can change quickly.
Impacts in your area:

Road closures: 
  • Pyrenees Highway from Ararat to Amphitheatre 
  • Beaufort-Lexton Road  
  • Lexton Ararat Road 
  • Main Lead Road at Jackson Street, Beaufort to Raglan 
  • Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan 
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road from Raglan to Elmhurst 
  • Amphitheatre Road from Amphitheatre to Chute 
  • Mount Cole Road from Warrak to Mt Cole
  • Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway 
  • Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor 
  • Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo, 
  • Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.
Relief centres are open at:

  •  Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.

  • Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.

  • For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).  

Beaufort Urgent Care Centre

The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM.  Outside these hours, community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. 

The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.   

Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.   

The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Mt Cole Fire.

State Forest closures: 
  • Mount Cole State Forest 
  • Ben Major State Forest 
  • Mt Lonarch State Forest 
  • Fortes Bush State Forest 
  • Musical Gully State Forest
  • Camphill State Forest  

Parks Victoria closures:- 
  • Mount Buangor State Park  (those who have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)- 
  • Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR)  

Community information and newsletter 

Community meetings are planned for Tuesday 27 February in Avoca Shire Hall at 10am and Beaufort Shire Hall at 2.00pm  

Read our newsletter for more community information.

Also a community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate  A recording of the Meeting is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68lLrwz/ 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Incident Location: Bayindeen-Rocky Road
Issue Date: Monday 26 February 2024, 02:45 pm

- Heavy plant, machinery and aircraft will be visible in the area. 


Planning for extreme fire danger Wednesday 28 February

- Review your fire plan with household members today.
- Consider leaving your property on Tuesday afternoon. 

- If you have any questions about recovering from this fire, you should call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Lakes Entrance beach.

  • Due to a whale carcass, there could be an increase in shark activity.
  • The whale carcass is located at the east of Drew's Jetty. 
  • A whale carcass can attract sharks to the area and mean they are closer to the shore than normal.
  • While it is not uncommon for sharks to be present off the Victorian coast, you should exercise additional caution in the area.
Avoid the area. Stay informed and do not enter the water at closed beaches.
What you should do:

  • If you see sharks, report the sighting by calling Triple Zero (000) or notify lifesavers immediately if you are at a patrolled beach.
Staying safe at nearby beaches:
  • Always swim, dive or surf with a friend.
  • Swim between the red and yellow flags on patrolled beaches.
  • Don't swim in places where human or animal waste enters the water.
  • Keep away from large schools of fish, seals or other wildlife as these can attract sharks.
Impacts in your area:
  • The Victorian Fisheries Authority is monitoring for shark sightings and providing advice to relevant authorities. 
This message was issued by VFA.

The next update is expected by 29/02/2024 03:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

ADVICE - DANGEROUS ANIMAL - Avoid the Area
Incident Location: Lakes Entrance
Issue Date: Thursday 22 February 2024, 03:04 pm
Next Update: Thursday 29 February 2024, 03:10 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/32948/moreinfo

- The whale carcass is located at the east of Drew's Jetty. 
- A whale carcass can attract sharks to the area and mean they are closer to the shore than normal.
- While it is not uncommon for sharks to be present off the Victorian coast, you should exercise additional caution in the area. 


Avoid the area. Stay informed and do not enter the water at closed beaches.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Raglan, Eurambeen, Buangor East, Buangor, Middle Creek
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Buangor, Middle Creek, Raglan, Eurambeen, Buangor East. 

  • The Bayindeen-Rocky Road fire started last Thursday and has grown to the size 20,000 hectares.
  • Weather conditions are favourable for firefighting efforts.
  • This work is required ahead of Wednesday's predicted extreme fire danger rating.
  • Heavy plant, machinery and aircraft will be visible in the area. 
Planning for extreme fire danger Wednesday 28 February
  • Review your fire plan with household members today.
  • Consider leaving your property on Tuesday afternoon. 
  • If you have any questions about recovering from this fire, you should call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Do no travel on closed roads.    

Burnt areas are dangerous. Hazardous trees can fall at any time causing serious injury or death. 

You should stay informed as the fire situation can change quickly.
What you should do: 
  • Stay alert - be aware of hazards caused by the fire. 
  • Be aware of road hazards such as fallen trees and any road closures. 
  • Check your home or building for damage before you re-enter. 
  • If you have any questions about recovering from this fire, you should call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area:

The following roads are closed:
  • Pyrenees Highway from Ararat to Amphitheatre 
  • Beaufort-Lexton Road 
  • Lexton Ararat Road 
  • Main Lead Road at King Street
  • Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan 
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road from Raglan to Elmhurst 
  • Amphitheatre Road from Amphitheatre to Chute 
  • Mount Cole Road from Warrak to Mt Cole 
  • Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway 
  • Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor 
  • Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo, 
  • Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.

Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 

Relief centres are open at:
- Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
- Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.

Beaufort Urgent Care Centre
The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM. Outside these hours community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. 
The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.

For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).

Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.   

The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen-Rocky Road Fire.

State Forest:
  • Mount Cole State Forest
  • Ben Major State Forest
  • Mt Lonarch State Forest
  • Fortes Bush State Forest
  • Musical Gully State Forest
  • Camphill State Forest   

Parks Victoria closures:
  • Mount Buangor State Park  (those whom have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)
  • Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR)  

Community Meeting
Community meetings are planned for Tuesday 27 February in Avoca Shire Hall at 10am and Beaufort Shire Hall at 2.00pm    

Read our newsletter for more community information.       

Also, a community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate  A recording of the Meeting is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  


Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Pine Grove .

  • There is a haystack fire at Pine Grove. 
  • Haystack fires are not likely to spread into grassland but do generate a lot of smoke.
  • This fire may continue to burn for a number of days.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities as firefighters pull apart the hay to extinguish the fire. 
  • Firefighters are monitoring this fire.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to cal VicEmergency
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Amphitheatre, Bayindeen, Ben Nevis, Chute, Elmhurst, Eversley, Glenlogie, Mount Cole, Mount Lonarch, Raglan
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Amphitheatre, Bayindeen, Ben Nevis, Chute, Elmhurst, Eversley, Glenlogie, Mount Cole, Mount Lonarch, Raglan.  

  • It is Not Safe to Return to the Warning area. 
  • The bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky Road that is not yet under control and is still active in this area. 
  • The Bayindeen-Rocky Road fire started last Thursday and has grown to the size 20,000 hectares.  
  • Firefighting operations will be occurring overnight.  Fire and smoke may be visible.
  • This work is required ahead of Wednesday's predicted extreme fire danger rating.
It is Not Safe to Return.

If you have not left, leaving now is your best option.
What you should do:
If you have not already left: 
  • Conditions will be significantly worse on Wednesday so leaving now is your safest option. 
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications.

If you have already left: 

Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued. 

Relief centres are open at:
  • Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
  • Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.
Register at a relief centre so that your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
  
  • For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Impacts in your area:

The following roads are closed: 
  • Pyrenees Highway from Ararat to Amphitheatre 
  • Beaufort-Lexton Road Lexton 
  • Ararat Road Main Lead Road at King Street 
  • Beaufort to Raglan Eurambeen-Raglan Road, 
  • Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan 
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road from Raglan to Elmhurst 
  • Amphitheatre Road from Amphitheatre to Chute 
  • Mount Cole Road from Warrak to Mt Cole 
  • Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway 
  • Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor 
  • Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo, 
  • Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.

Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.  

Beaufort Urgent Care Centre
  • The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM.  Outside these hours, community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. 
  • The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.   
  • Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.   

The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Rocky Road Fire.

State Forest Closures
  • Mount Cole State Forest 
  • Ben Major State Forest
  • Mt Lonarch State Forest 
  • Fortes Bush State Forest 
  • Musical Gully State Forest 
  • Camphill State Forest  

Parks Victoria closures: 
  • Mount Buangor State Park (those who have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)- 
  • Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR)  

Community Meeting
Community meetings are planned for Tuesday 27 February in Avoca Shire Hall at 10am and Beaufort Shire Hall at 2.00pm 

Read our newsletter for more community information.   

Also, a community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate  A recording of the Meeting is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 
The next update is expected by 27/02/2024 07:30 am or as the situation changes. 
Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Dadswells Bridge, Roses Gap, Glenorchy, Laharum, Wartook
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Dadswells Bridge. 

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park, Mt  Stapylton that is under control.
  • Fire crews remain in the area monitoring conditions. 
  • Take extra precaution around trees during high winds. 
  • There are reduced speed limits in place on the Western Highway through Dadswells Bridge.
  • Areas of the Grampians National Park near the Bellfield fire remain closed. For detailed information on which areas of the park are open or closed, visit parks.vic.gov.au


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required. 
Plan for the elevated fire danger weather predicted for Wednesday.
Enact your fire plan. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 27/02/2024 01:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Glenpatrick, Glenshee, Nowhere Creek, Avoca, Elmhurst, Eversley, Glenlofty, Percydale, Warrenmang
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Avoca, Elmhurst, Eversley, Glenlofty, Glenpatrick, Glenshee, Nowhere Creek, Percydale, Warrenmang.

  • The Bayindeen-Rocky Road fire started last Thursday and is now 20,000 hectares.
  • Firefighting operations will be occurring overnight on Monday.  Fire and smoke may be visible.
  • This work is required ahead of Wednesday's predicted extreme fire danger rating. 
  • Heavy plant, machinery and aircraft will be visible in the area. 

Planning for extreme fire danger Wednesday 28 February
  • Review your fire plan with household members today.
  • Consider leaving your property on Tuesday afternoon. 
  • If you need further information on protecting yourself and your family: www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire or call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226.
Do no travel on closed roads.   

You should stay informed as the fire situation can change quickly.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • If you have any questions about recovering from this fire, you should call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area: 

  • The following roads are closed: 
  • Pyrenees Highway from Ararat to Amphitheatre  
  • Beaufort-Lexton Road   
  • Lexton Ararat Road  
  • Main Lead Road at King Street, Beaufort to Raglan  
  • Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan 
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road from Raglan to Elmhurst  
  • Amphitheatre Road from Amphitheatre to Chute  
  • Mount Cole Road from Warrak to Mt Cole 
  • Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway  
  • Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor  
  • Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo,  
  • Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.

Relief centres are open at: 
  • Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
  • Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.

Beaufort Urgent Care Centre

  • The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM.  Outside these hours, community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. 
  • For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).
  • The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.   
  • Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  
  • Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.  

The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Rocky Road Fire.

State Forest Closures
  • Mount Cole State Forest
  • Ben Major State Forest
  • Mt Lonarch State Forest
  • Fortes Bush State Forest
  • Musical Gully State Forest
  • Camphill State Forest.
Parks Victoria closures:
  • Mount Buangor State Park  (those who have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)
  • Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR) 
Community Meeting  
Community meetings are planned for Tuesday 27 February in Avoca Shire Hall at 10am and Beaufort Shire Hall at 2.00pm.  
  
Read our newsletter for more community information.  
     
Also, a community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate  A recording of the Meeting is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 27/02/2024 04:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Bayindeen-Rocky Road
Issue Date: Monday 26 February 2024, 10:32 pm
Next Update: Tuesday 27 February 2024, 04:40 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/33151/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Avoca, Elmhurst, Eversley, Glenlofty, Glenpatrick, Glenshee, Nowhere Creek, Percydale, Warrenmang.

- The Bayindeen-Rocky Road fire started last Thursday and is now 20,000 hectares.
- Firefighting operations will be occurring overnight on Monday.  Fire and smoke may be visible.
- This work is required ahead of Wednesday's predicted extreme fire danger rating. 
- Heavy plant, machinery and aircraft will be visible in the area. 


Planning for extreme fire danger Wednesday 28 February
- Review your fire plan with household members today.
- Consider leaving your property on Tuesday afternoon. 
- If you need further information on protecting yourself and your family: www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire or call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226.



Do no travel on closed roads.   

You should stay informed as the fire situation can change quickly.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Main Lead, Waterloo. 
  • It is Not Safe to Return to the Warning area. 
  • The bushfire at Bayindeen Rocky Road is not yet under control and is still active in this area. 
  • Firefighter operations will be occurring overnight.  Fire may be visible.
  • The Bayindeen-Rocky Road fire started last Thursday and has grown to the size 20,000 hectares. 
  • Weather conditions are favourable for firefighting efforts overnight.
  • Heavy plant and machinery will be visible in the area. 
It is Not Safe to Return

If you have not left, leaving now is your best option.
What you should do:
If you have not already left: 
  • Conditions will be significantly worse on Wednesday so leaving now is your safest option.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications.

If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued. 
  • A relief centre is open at:
    - Ararat Football Ground, Alexandra Oval, Waratah Street, Ararat.
    - Princes Park, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.
  • Register at a relief centre so that your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Impacts in your area:

The following roads are closed:
  • Pyrenees Highway from Ararat to Amphitheatre 
  • Beaufort-Lexton Road 
  • Lexton Ararat Road 
  • Main Lead Road at King Street Beaufort to Raglan 
  • Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan 
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road from Raglan to Elmhurst 
  • Amphitheatre Road from Amphitheatre to Chute 
  • Mount Cole Road from Warrak to Mt Cole 
  • Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway 
  • Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor 
  • Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo, 
  • Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 

Relief centres are open at: 
- Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
- Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough. For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).

Beaufort Urgent Care Centre
  • The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM.  Outside these hours, community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. 
  • The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.  
  • Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.    

The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Rocky Road Fire.

State Forest closures:
  • Mount Cole State Forest 
  • Ben Major State Forest 
  • Mt Lonarch State Forest 
  • Fortes Bush State Forest 
  • Musical Gully State Forest 
  • Camphill State Forest 
Parks Vic Closures
  • Mount Buangor State Park (those who have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria) 
  • Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR) Community Meeting  
Community Meeting
Community meetings are planned for Tuesday 27 February in Avoca Shire Hall at 10am and Beaufort Shire Hall at 2.00pm     
 
Read our newsletter for more community information.   

Also, a community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate  A recording of the Meeting is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 
The next update is expected by 27/02/2024 07:10 am or as the situation changes. 
Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Green Hill Creek, Lexton, Rosyth, Lamplough
properties.webBody:
This advice message is issued for Green Hill Creek, Lamplough, Lexton and Rosyth.

  • The Bayindeen-Rocky Road fire started last Thursday and has grown to the size 20,000 hectares.
  • Weather conditions are favourable for firefighting efforts and burning out activities will occur in the next 24 hours.
  • This work is required ahead of Wednesday's predicted extreme fire danger rating.
  • Community may notice an increase in smoke in the area while the burning out activities are undertaken. 
  • Heavy plant, machinery and aircraft will be visible in the area. 

Planning for extreme fire danger Wednesday 28 February
  • Review your fire plan with household members today.
  • Consider leaving your property on Tuesday afternoon. 
  • If you have any questions about recovering from this fire, you should call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
The threat is reduced.   

Do no travel on closed roads.   

You should stay informed as the fire situation can change quickly.
Impacts in your area:

The following roads are closed: 
  • Pyrenees Highway from Ararat to Amphitheatre  
  • Beaufort-Lexton Road   
  • Lexton Ararat Road  
  • Main Lead Road at Jackson Street, Beaufort to Raglan  
  • Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan 
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road from Raglan to Elmhurst  
  • Amphitheatre Road from Amphitheatre to Chute  
  • Mount Cole Road from Warrak to Mt Cole 
  • Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway  
  • Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor  
  • Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo,  
  • Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.

Relief centres are open at:- 

  • Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
  • Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.
  • For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).

Beaufort Urgent Care Centre

The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM.  Outside these hours, community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. 

The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.   

Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  

Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.      

The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Mt Cole Fire.

State Forest Closures
  • Mount Cole State Forest- 
  • Ben Major State Forest- 
  • Mt Lonarch State Forest- 
  • Fortes Bush State Forest- 
  • Musical Gully State Forest- 
  • Camphill State Forest.

Parks Victoria closures:- 
  • Mount Buangor State Park  (those whom have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)- 
  • Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR) 

Community Meeting  

Community meetings are planned for Tuesday 27 February in Avoca Shire Hall at 10am and Beaufort Shire Hall at 2.00pm    

Read our newsletter for more community information.    
   
Also, a community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate  A recording of the Meeting is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Planning for extreme fire danger Wednesday 28 February

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This message is being issued for water quality at Lake Bolac. 
  • High levels of blue-green algae have been detected in the lake. 
  • The algal bloom is expected to remain until there is significant rainfall to flush the lake or cooler conditions slow the algae. 
  • Regular testing is being conducted to identify new outbreaks or changes that might indicate improved water quality. 
  • This notification will be reviewed weekly and updated as the situation changes.
Warning signs have been installed at the lake.

You should avoid direct contact with affected water in Lake Bolac.

Do not swim in affected areas or use water for cooking, drinking, washing or showering. Boiling the water will not make it safe. 
What you should do:
  • Visit Parks Victoria website (https://www.parks.vic.gov.au/places-to-see/parks/lake-bolac-highway-park) for more information. 
  • Observe information signs posted at the lake.
Protect your health:
  • Direct contact with water affected by blue green algae can cause skin irritation, sore eyes, ears and nose. If swallowed it can cause cramps, nausea and vomiting. 
  • If you do come into contact with affected water, wash your skin immediately in clean cool water. 
  • Boiling affected water does not make it safe to drink. Boiling water bursts the blue green algae cells and releases toxins into the water making it more likely that you will experience symptoms. 
  • If you are experiencing any health issues after contact with affected water seek medical advice from your local doctor or Nurse-On-Call on 1300 60 60 24.
Protect your pets:
  • Pet owners should prevent pets from drinking or having direct contact with contaminated water. 
Agriculture information: 
  • Irrigation water contaminated with blue-green algae should not be spray irrigated on vegetables and fruit, or come in contact with plants being grown for food during processing and packing. 
  • Fruit and vegetables grown in the affected areas are safe to consume if farmers follow recommendations regarding blue-green algae
Impacts in your area:
  • The water is  green as a result of the algae bloom.
Boating and fishing:
  • Boating and fishing is still allowed in these areas, however care needs to be taken.
  • Fish caught from affected areas should be rinsed and cleaned thoroughly in fresh water, and internal organs removed from the fish and discarded before eating. 
  • Do not eat mussels, crayfish or yabbies caught from the affected area. 
This message was issued by Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Action.

The next update is expected by 31/03/2024 05:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Information about blue green algae:
  • For information on blue green algae visit: www2.health.vic.gov.au/public-health/water/blue-green-algae-cyanobac teria.
Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter.
  • Tune into ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Warning signs have been installed at the lake. 
You should avoid direct contact with affected water in Lake Bolac.

Do not swim in affected areas or use water for cooking, drinking, washing or showering. Boiling the water will not make it safe.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Lake Fyans, Pomonal, Bellfield, Halls Gap, Moyston
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Pomonal and surrounding communities.  

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park, Bellfield that is under control.
  • Fire crews remain in the area monitoring conditions.
  • Take extra precautions during high winds. 
  • Areas of the Grampians National Park near the Bellfield fire remain closed.  Check parks.vic.gov.au for more information.
  • Access to Pomonal is restricted to local residents, emergency services and essential services. Check the VicTraffic website (VicTraffic) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required. 
Plan for the elevated fire danger weather predicted for Wednesday. 
Enact your fire plan. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 27/02/2024 01:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
